alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 10 at 2:48AM PST until January 11 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 3 PM PST THURSDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet with local max sets to 9 feet. Dangerous rip currents are likely. Surf highest on west-facing beaches. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 3 PM PST Thursday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 4 AM to noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of sea water is likely, around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas such as parking lots, beaches, and walkways. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Morning high tide Thursday is predicted to be near 7.3 feet at around 820 AM.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
